title: Theodore Roosevelt Birthplace National Historic Site: The Sights of Theodore Roosevelt
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Multimedia Presentations     The Sights of Theodore Roosevelt                The Sights of Theodore Roosevelt         This is a frame from a silent motion picture of Theodore Roosevelt and his friends from the 'Rough Riders' Volunteer Cavalry Regiment, circa 1910. Library of Congress  Theodore Roosevelt, as an adult, was never shy of crowds and basked in the attention of his supporters. Early on, he recognized the value of the 'photo op' to promote himself, and utilized photographs, as well as the news media, to their fullest extent. When 'motion pictures' were invented, thanks to the efforts of Thomas Alva Edison, Theodore seized upon this new form of 'social media'. His innately animated movements and abundant energy made him a natural for the motion picture lens. Many of these films have been archived by the Library of Congress.
